'''Colton Harris-Moore''' (born March 22, 1991), better known as '''Colt''' in his home town, is a 19-year-old [[fugitive]] from [[Camano Island, Washington]]. He is suspected in the [[theft]] of at least three small aircraft, a boat, and a car,<ref name=holtz-09-dec /> and in the [[burglary|burglaries]] of at least 100 private residences in various locations around the [[Pacific Northwest]] of the United States and Canada.<ref name=stevick /><ref name=katu /><ref>{{cite news |author= |coauthors= |title=America's Most Wanted Teen-Aged Bandit |url=http://www.time.com/time/magazine/article/0,9171,1946950,00.html |quote=Colton Harris-Moore, a gangly 19-year-old with furtive eyes and a dimpled chin, has been on police blotters since he was accused of stealing a bike at the age of 8. Since then, he is suspected of having committed nearly 100 burglaries in Washington, Idaho and Canada. Police allege that he graduated from bikes to cars, then to speedboats. Lately, he is suspected of stealing four small aircraft â all the more impressive given that he has never taken a single flying lesson2. ...|work=[[Time magazine]] |date=December 21, 2009 |accessdate=2009-12-14 }}</ref>
+
'''Colton Harris-Moore''' (born March 22, 1991), better known as '''Colt''' in his home town, is a 19-year-old [[fugitive]] from [[Camano Island, Washington]]. He is suspected in the [[theft]] of at least three small aircraft, a boat, and a car,<ref name=holtz-09-dec /> and in the [[burglary|burglaries]] of at least 100 private residences in various locations around the [[Pacific Northwest]] of the United States and Canada.<ref name=stevick /><ref name=katu /><ref>{{cite news |author= |coauthors= |title=America's Most Wanted Teen-Aged Bandit |url=http://www.time.com/time/magazine/article/0,9171,1946950,00.html |quote=Colton Harris-Moore, a gangly 19-year-old with furtive eyes and a dimpled chin, has been on police blotters since he was accused of stealing a bike at the age of 8. Since then, he is suspected of having committed nearly 100 burglaries in Washington, Idaho and Canada. Police allege that he graduated from bikes to cars, then to speedboats. Lately, he is suspected of stealing four small aircraft â all the more impressive given that he has never taken a single flying lesson. ...|work=[[Time magazine]] |date=December 21, 2009 |accessdate=2009-12-14 }}</ref>
After reportedly committing some of his crimes barefooted, he was dubbed "the Barefoot Bandit"; at one (at least) of his crime scenes he has mocked police by drawing cartoonish footprints in chalk.<ref>http://www.kirotv.com/news/23939095/detail.html retrieved 9/17/2010</ref> He is 6 feet and 5 inches tall.{{Citation needed|date=April 2010}}
After reportedly committing some of his crimes barefooted, he was dubbed "the Barefoot Bandit"; at one (at least) of his crime scenes he has mocked police by drawing cartoonish footprints in chalk.<ref>http://www.kirotv.com/news/23939095/detail.html retrieved 9/17/2010</ref> He is 6 feet and 5 inches tall.{{Citation needed|date=April 2010}}
